results.title: Continents adrift
results.creator_credit: American Educational Films and Lewis C. Hall
results.brief_description: Shows how a scientific hypothesis becomes established in a study of Alfred Wegener’s hypothesis that at one time all the continents were one. Discusses paleomagnetism, sea floor spreading, magnetism in rock and the drifting magnetic poles. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Continental drift: the theory of plate tectonics
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: Outlines the major features of the theory of plate tectonics and notes how the theory can be used to explain the distribution of the world’s major earthquake zones and areas of volcanic activity. Provides ample evidence to support the validity of the theory of plate tectonics and explores some possible explanations as to how the plates actually move. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Continental drift
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: An exposition through film animation of the theory that Earth’s land areas are fluid and that, in the process of a slow, rolling, boiling motion, one part of the Earth might well be engulfed and then rise again some distance away, much the same as froth on a kettle of soup. From this theory comes the idea that continents were formed from one super-continent that broke up, whose pieces sank, and then rose once more, but far apart. Introducing the film is Professor J. Tuzo Wilson, geophysicist, University of Toronto. Animation by Co Hoedeman. (Award: London.)

results.title: Continental divide
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Amblin Entertainment, Bob Larson and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy starring John Belushi as a Chicago reporter who becomes a Mafia target following his series of articles exposing corruption. Hoping to alleviate the situation, his editor sends him on an assignment to a remote location in the Rocky Mountains to write a feature story on a reclusive researcher (Blair Brown) studying the endangered American bald eagle. Initially reluctant, she lets Belushi stay and despite radical differences their mutual attraction gradually draws them together. Cast also includes: Allen Goorwitz, Carlyn Glynn, Tony Ganios, Val Avery and Bill Henderson. Music composed and conducted by Michael Small. Editing, Dennis Virkler. Cinematography, John Bailey. Script, Lawrence Kasdan.

results.title: Continental Circus
results.brief_description:
The racing careers and exploits of two contrasting characters are explored in this French documentary about small motorcycle racing. One is the Australian Jack Findlay, who manages to stay in the game through sheer spunk and the help of his French wife and many friends. He often has accidents, lacks a corporate sponsor, and sometimes must borrow even the machines he races with. Giacomo Agostini, on the other hand, seems to be singularly blessed. As the reigning champion (in 1971) and a noteworthy playboy, he has all the sponsorship he could ask for, and wins his races without injuries or spills. This film highlights the difficulty and even fatal dangers of this form of racing. Awards: Prix Jean Vigo 1972.

Credits: Producer, Jacques Zajderman ; director, Jerome Laperrousaz ; writer, Jerome Laperrousaz ; photography, Jimmy Glasberg, Jean-Paul Jansen, Raymond Meyer ; music, Gong.
Cast: Jack Findlay, Nanou, Giacomo Agostini.

results.title: Continent in crisis
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Malcolm Paterson and David Smith
results.brief_description: The Australian environment is in severe ecological crisis with soil degradation, salinity and deforestation all taking their toll on the land. But it is not all doom and gloom. Through satellite technology using remote sensing and computer analysis, scientists are able to plot the landscape on a daily, even hourly, basis and chart such occurrences as bushfires, floods, vegetation regrowth etc. This allows for future planning both environmentally and economically. “Continent in crisis” is a celebration of Australia’s natural beauty from the red centre, to the rainforests to the Great Barrier Reef and of the world-ranking environmental research being undertaken by CSIRO and others.

results.title: Contexts of development
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses the theory of “context” where each child is unique (biological context), but part of the environment (immediate, socio-economic and cultural contexts).

results.title: Context, concept and structure (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading Development”.
Shows 7-9 year old children from Saffron Green First School, Boreham Wood, England, involved in activities designed to develop intermediate reading skills. Includes sentence building with pictures and phrases; sentence building without pictures; editing a story based on existing sentences; understanding anaphora, structuring an attributes matrix; group working on a cloze passage.

results.title: Contests USA
results.brief_description: Skip Blumberg presents, in his customary fashion, a series of short films examining the bizarre and the sublime in America in the 1980s. ‘Summer Ski Jumping’ follows the 33rd annual event ski enthusiasts who take over the Olympic ski jump in Lake Placid on the 4th of July and execute jumps over imported snow sometimes during temperatures reaching 100 degrees. ‘Ugly Dog Contest’ presents a subversion of the traditional dog show with a series of unusual looking dogs in line to take the prize of ugliest dog. ‘Festival of the Saw’ captures the international celebration of saw playing in Santa Cruz, with an examination of the demise of saw playing during the 1920s and its subsequent revival.

results.title: Contempt = Le Mepris
results.creator_credit: Rome Paris Films, Concordia, C C Champion (Rome), Georges de Beauregard, Carlo Ponti and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: When aspiring playwright Paul Javal (Michel Piccoli) is called in as script doctor on a film of The Odyssey, he is caught between a director (Fritz Lang) who wants to capture the reality of Homer’s world, and crass producer Prokosch (Jack Palance) who just wants more mermaids. As his artistic integrity gradually succumbs to the power of Prakosch’s chequebook, his wife Camille (Bardot) regards him with increasing contempt. This video includes the original cinema trailer.
